author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of gold, to futures bold, a tale of woe I weave,  
A herald's fell decree, its luster doth bereave.  
Tensions 'cross Eastern lands, their shadows in retreat,  
Heaven's safe demand, yea, from its golden seat.  

Once, oil's price stood firm, ensconced in Mid-East fright,  
Now, lower does it turn, by more than one percent's might.  
Fears, once aflame with reel, do fade in war's discourse,  
Yet higher interest real, weighs heavy on its course.  

The dollar, noble steed, 'gainst risk found no defense,  
By week's end, 'tis decreed, its rise may yet commence.  
For Middle Eastern dread, hath ceased its rampant reign,  
Data ahead may tread, to raise its worth again.

feedItems.title: Gold Futures Prices Drop as Safe-Haven Demand Melts Away
feedItems.description: Gold futures fell 1.8% as diminishing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East hit safe-haven demand.

feedItems.title: Oil Falls More Than 1% on Easing Middle East Fears, Economic Concerns
feedItems.description: Oil prices fell more than 1% as fears of a broader conflict in the Middle East faded and the prospect of higher-for-longer interest rates weighed on sentiment.

feedItems.title: Dollar Falls on Better Risk Sentiment, Could Get Lift From U.S. Data This Week
feedItems.description: The dollar edged lower as risk sentiment improves due to easing concerns about Middle East tensions, though U.S. data later this week could push the currency higher again, ING said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Hear, O wise ones, the tale of CVC's might,
In Amsterdam's halls, it seeks precious light.
In golden standards, sixteen billion in claim,
An IPO quest, in the trading game.

Behold, Fair Italy, noble in bond,
Its BBB rating, a sturdy frond.
'Bove German Bunds, it holds its gaze,
In early trade, an emblem ablaze.

In distant China, where dragons dwell,
Tesla, Li Auto, in price war's hell.
They lower the tag, as chariots spark,
In battle electric, far from traditional arc.

feedItems.title: CVC Looks to Raise €250 Million in Amsterdam Float
feedItems.description: CVC has priced its IPO implying a market valuation of up to $16 billion and said it planned to raise €250 million.

feedItems.title: Italian Bonds Marginally Outperform Bunds After S&P Affirms Rating, Outlook
feedItems.description: Italian BTPs marginally outperformed Bunds in early European trade after S&P affirmed Italy’s BBB rating and stable outlook.

feedItems.title: Tesla, Li Auto Cut Prices as China's EV Price War Heats Up
feedItems.description: Tesla and Li Auto cut prices further in China amid an intensifying price war that comes as sales of electric vehicles surpassed that of traditional cars for the first time.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Oh, sweet Hipgnosis, abode of minstrels dear,
Blackstone hath proffer'd golden ale so clear.
For billion and half, 'twould recommend, 
Should formal draught to their hands extend.

In yonder East, o'er span of two score years,
China shipwrights, casting off all fears,
Like abbey brew masters with vat and cask,
Cement their maritime might, no easy task.

Niger, with voice as stern as abbot's call,
Bids U.S. troops from their shores to fall.
Their counter-insurgency plan's now void,
And violent insurgents thus are overjoyed.

feedItems.title: Hipgnosis Gets $1.5 Billion Approach From Blackstone
feedItems.description: Hipgnosis, home to the catalogue of artists such as Neil Young, Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers, said it received a $1.5 billion approach from Blackstone that it would be prepared to recommend if a formal offer was made.

feedItems.title: Inside the Strategies That Made China a Shipbuilding Powerhouse
feedItems.description: Over the past two decades, China has transformed into a shipbuilding powerhouse—cementing its status as a major maritime power. Shipbuilding experts break down why this is such a strategic asset and where the U.S. stands as naval competition heats up.

feedItems.title: Niger has formally ordered the U.S. to withdraw counterterrorism troops, derailing an American strategy to defeat a violent Islamist insurgency.
feedItems.description: Niger has formally ordered the U.S. to withdraw counterterrorism troops, derailing an American strategy to defeat a violent Islamist insurgency.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Ukraine's firm stand, they clutch at hope,
Like rabbits chased by hounds in dawn’s pale light.
Aid from afar, stark lifeline bound in rope,
May yet defend them in their bitter fight.

In Qatar's warmth, Hamas now plans their flight,
Like fleet-foot goats pushed from their rocky hold.
Where will they turn in gathering twilight? 
As U.S. hawks their cease-fire dreams unfold.

The Senate's word, like snails, cautious but bold,
Renew the spy's dark power, feared and profane.
Yet whispers echo, truths as yet untold,
The dogs of privacy cry out in vain.

feedItems.title: The House vote to approve funding for Ukraine comes at a desperate moment for the country's beleaguered defenders and holds the prospect of helping them stave off a Russian onslaught at the last possible moment.
feedItems.description: The House vote to approve funding for Ukraine comes at a desperate moment for the country’s beleaguered defenders and holds the prospect of helping them stave off a Russian onslaught at the last possible moment.

feedItems.title: Hamas's political leadership is looking to move from its base in Qatar, as U.S. legislators build pressure on the Gulf state to deliver on cease-fire negotiations that look likely to fail.
feedItems.description: Hamas’s political leadership is looking to move from its base in Qatar, as U.S. legislators build pressure on the Gulf state to deliver on cease-fire negotiations that look likely to fail.

feedItems.title: The Senate has passed legislation renewing a controversial foreign spying power, prevailing over objections from privacy advocates.
feedItems.description: The Senate has passed legislation renewing a controversial foreign spying power, prevailing over objections from privacy advocates.
